message.body: Hi :)
Hello! Sorry for the radio silence. @ Bonnaroo!
No worries :) is it raining where you are?
Not yet, but i think its on the way. You? Where are you, btw?
Princeton nj :) it was scary earlier but better now :)
Right on. What do you do in princeton?
I'm a grad student, how about you?
Electrician for money. For fun i like travel, pretty much anything involving water, esp. scuba & paddling. I'm also pretty civicly engaged. What do you study?
Indian history :) where was your last trip?
Nice area of study! Ive only been able to travel in the US the last few years, but i'm en route to canada @ the moment. lived in India for over a year though.
Are you of Indian descent or just interested?
Where in india did you live?
Lived in Delhi but travelled a pretty good deal, mostly in the north. In the south a little bit.
My parents are south Asian but I was worn in Chicago. Ah I lived in lucknow for two years :) did you ever visit?
*born
Lucknow? Whats that near?
It's in UP, south of Nepal, go towards Agra from Delhi and keep going :)
Any monuments of note? it def sounds familiar. did you get to travel around the country much? I really loved india, & it totally exhausted me.
Its been a few years, & i got around a lot. I really need to go back & look @ my india travel journals.
It was the capital of the nawabs of avadh and there are some beautiful mosques called imambaras
It's not really on the tourist map but I think it should be!
I loved the mosques & muslim-inspired architecture i saw throughout south asia. The jama masjid & all the mughal bldgs, spelling?, in north india were amazing!

Since india is my area of research I get to go there a lot. It exhausts me as well :) last time I went for two months and it was too long so next time I'll only go for a month an then retreat to the good old us of a :)
Ah well I study islam in south Asia so you're talking tithe right person :) unfortunately the guides at a lot of those places aren't very well informed.
Where are you headed in Canada?
